intro: Saussurea calophylla, commonly known as the Chinese yarrow or Himalayan safflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas and Central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and feathery leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to cold climates. Its flowers, which bloom in summer, range from white to pale yellow, and its roots are often used in traditional medicine. Saussurea calophylla is valued for its aromatic properties and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
